title.value: Picture Cards Versus Physical Examination: A Proof-of-Concept Study to Improve the SOSAS Survey Tool
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Picture Cards Versus Physical Examination: A Proof-of-Concept Study to Improve the SOSAS Survey Tool

extractions.description: The paper discusses a proof-of-concept study aimed at improving the SOSAS survey tool by comparing the use of patient-reported picture cards versus physical examination in the determination of surgically treatable conditions in the community.

type.justification: The paper involves a proof-of-concept study which typically involves empirical research methods such as experiments or observations.
type.quote: Evaluation of patient-reported picture cards versus physical examination in the determination of surgically treatable conditions in the community: a proof-of-concept study to improve the SOSAS survey tool.

name.justification: The paper is centered around surgery and improving medical tools, indicating its focus is on medical research.
name.quote: The Surgeons OverSeas Assessment of Surgical Needs (SOSAS) survey tool is used to determine the unmet surgical needs in the community.

name.justification: The paper aims to improve a surgical needs assessment tool, placing it within the domain of surgical research.
name.quote: Picture Cards Versus Physical Examination: A Proof-of-Concept Study to Improve the SOSAS Survey Tool
